list_definition.definition: a set time for children to play (at school etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The children go outside at playtime.

list_ex_of_english: A debate such as we shall have today should rather be regarded as a genial interlude in a long series of dull discussions—rather like the playtime interval at school.
I have become concerned about the lack of experienced and suitably qualified supervisors at playtimes and particularly at lunchtime.
You have depleted our docks, you have ruined our shipping, and you have left our docksides and quays as mere playtime places for the children.
For these purposes we framed a scenario involving two children in school at playtime.
I hate school. 1 hate the playtimes.
Will my noble friend encourage schools to use some of the additional resources that they will be receiving to improve the quality of the supervision of children during playtime periods?
To offer a child at playtime a soft drink instead of milk was to offer it an almost irresistible alternative.
They are providing for the workers' playtime.
